alert.note: Alert for New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:53AM EST until January 11 at 8:39PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in New York NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Connecticut... Yantic River near Yantic affecting New London County. For the Yantic River...including Yantic...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yantic River near Yantic. * WHEN...From early this morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding along Otrobando Avenue at the Fitness World, Pleasant Street bridge and along Town Street at the Norwichtown Mall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:31 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:31 AM EST Wednesday was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.9 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.9 feet on 03/02/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Yantic River Yantic 9.0 9.1 Wed 2 am EST 8.2 5.1 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 300 PM EST.
